Journal Story: Listening to "AWOL on the Appalachian trail" on my audible account on my iphone at work. looking forward to 3 day hike on the AT with our Boy Scout troop in Feb 2016.
Boy Scout Trip cancelled due to snow in February, better planning for a March Trip or a Jun trip may be good.May do Springer Mountain to Max Patch in Early November.

Took the Scout troop on a Day Hike of 6 Miles, Camped in Tents, Scout cooked their own meals and filtered water from the stream at Rufus morgan Shelter area, there was another troop there, several Thri hikers and a gentleman ffrom Germany, there were about 40 people in all at the site and our group spent about 2 hours trying to pull down a dead tree that was looming over the campsite. We had a great time and rafted at the NOC the next morning after a 1 mile hike out.

Took the Scout troop to Lemon Gap and hiked to Roaring fork shelter. The Scouts stayed up cooking and singing scout songs in the drizzling rain Next morning was very foggy and we went up to MAX PATCH. Foggy and windy and it seem like we were hiking in the clouds!. we hiked to Ground hog creek shelter and met "Grouchy Pants" and had a good time in that camp site. good water source up the hill and the boy liked the primitive outhouse. After a rough hike (up hill bothways) the scout Bus was a sight for sore eyes. We ended our journey with a feast at Arby's and Hardies.
